sen.j: 京極 高三（きょうごく たかみつ）は、丹後田辺藩（舞鶴藩）の初代藩主。
sen.e: Takamitsu KYOGOKU was the first lord of the Tanabe Clan of Tango Province (Maizuru Clan).
Takamitsu KYOGOKU was the first lord of the Tanabe Clan of Tango Province (Maizuru Clan).
Takamitsu KYOGOKU was the first lord of the Tanabe Domain of Tango Province (Maizuru han).
The Kyogoku clan.
The Kyogoku clan.
The Kyogoku clan.
The descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU.
The descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU.
The descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU.
The founder of the Kyogoku family of the Toyooka Domain.
The founder of the Kyogoku family of the Toyooka Domain.
The founder of the Kyogoku family of the Toyooka Domain.

sen.j: 慶長12年（1607年）3月17日、丹後国主・京極高知の三男として丹後田辺城で生まれる。
sen.e: On March 17, 1607, Takamitsu was born the third son of Takatomo KYOGOKU, the lord of Tango Province, in Tango Tanabe Castle.
On March 17, 1607, Takamitsu was born the third son of Takatomo KYOGOKU, the lord of Tango Province, in Tango Tanabe Castle.
On April 13, 1607, Takamitsu was born the third son of Takatomo KYOGOKU, the lord of Tango Province, in Tango Tanabe Castle.

sen.j: 慶長16年（1611年）、京都二条城で大御所の徳川家康と、江戸幕府第2代将軍・徳川秀忠に拝謁した。
sen.e: In 1611, Takamitsu had an audience with Ogosho (the leading figure) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and the Second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA in Nijo-jo Castle in Kyoto.
In 1611, Takamitsu had an audience with Ogosho (the leading figure) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and the Second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA in Nijo-jo Castle in Kyoto.
In 1611, Takamitsu had an audience with Ogosho (the leading figure) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and the second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA in Nijo-jo Castle in Kyoto.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)8年（1622年）に父が死去すると、その所領は高知の三子で分割相続されることとなり、高三は加佐郡3万5000石を相続し、田辺藩(舞鶴藩)の初代藩主となった。
sen.e: After the passing of his father Takatomo in 1622, it was decided that Takatomo's shoryou (territory) be divided among his 3 sons and Takamitsu inherited Kasa County with 35,000 goku becoming the founding lord of the Tanabe Clan (Maizuru Clan).

After the passing of his father Takatomo in 1622, it was decided that Takatomo's shoryou (territory) be divided among his 3 sons and Takamitsu inherited Kasa County with 35,000 goku becoming the founding lord of the Tanabe Clan (Maizuru Clan).

After the passing of his father Takatomo in 1622, it was decided that Takatomo's shoryo (territory) be divided among his three sons and Takamitsu inherited Kasa County with 35,000 koku becoming the founding lord of the Tanabe Domain (Maizuru han).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを修正。スペースを削除。「所領」を修正。「三子」の表記を修正。「3万5000石、田辺藩(舞鶴藩)」を修正

sen.e: Takamitsu died on September 13, 1636.
Takamitsu died on September 13, 1636.
Takamitsu died on October 11, 1636.
He was 30 years of age at death.
He was 30 years of age at death.
He was died at 30.
sen.cmt: 用語リストに合わせて修正

sen.j: 後を長男・高直が継いだ。
sen.e: Takanao, the eldest son of Takamitsu, succeeded the father's station.
Takanao, the eldest son of Takamitsu, succeeded the father's station.
Takanao, the eldest son of Takamitsu, succeeded the father's station.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを修正

sen.j: その後、京極家は孫の代で豊岡に転封となったが、娘婿にあたる牧野富成の子孫が舞鶴藩を継承した。
sen.e: Afterwards, the Kyogoku family changed territory to Toyooka during the times of grandchildren of Takamitsu but the descendants of Tomishige MAKINO who was the husband of Takamitsu's daughter inherited the Maizuru Domain.

Afterwards, the Kyogoku family changed territory to Toyooka during the generation of Takamitsu's grandchildren, but the descendants of Tomishige MAKINO the husband of Takamitsu's daughter inherited the Maizuru Domain.

Afterwards, the Kyogoku family changed territory to Toyooka during the generation of Takamitsu's grandchildren, but the descendants of Tomishige MAKINO the husband of Takamitsu's daughter inherited the Maizuru Domain.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除。アポストロフィを修正
